abstract: Chinese court sentences three civil rights activists to prison for inciting subversion; trial of Tang Jingling, Yuan Chaoyang and Wang Qingying, advocates of peaceful civil disobedience influenced by Mahatma Gandhi and American academic Gene Sharp, is part of Chinese Communist Party's recent crackdown on rights advocates.

headline.print_headline: 3 Rights Advocates Are Sentenced to Prison Terms in China
headline.main: 3 Rights Advocates Are Sentenced to Prison in China

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The advocates were sentenced to terms ranging from two and a half to five years after they were convicted of inciting subversion in the southern city of Guangzhou.
lead_paragraph: The advocates were sentenced to terms ranging from two and a half to five years after they were convicted of inciting subversion in the southern city of Guangzhou.
